statement.p: Darnell is conducting market research on the amount typically spent on the purchase of a first vehicle. Darnell has determined that the average cost of a first vehicle is 7500, and that the distribution of costs is normally distributed with a standard deviation of 740.
a. Find the probability that a single randomly selected first-time vehicle purchase is more than 6570. (Round to 4 decimal places.)
